bill_title: prohibit the sale of caffeinated alcoholic beverages.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit the sale of caffeinated alcoholic beverages. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. No person may sell or offer to sell any caffeinated alcoholic beverage. A violation of this section is a Class 1 misdemeanor. For the purposes of this section, a caffeinated alcoholic beverage is: (1) A beverage that is fermented in a manner similar to beer, from which some or all of the fermented alcohol has been removed and replaced with distilled ethyl alcohol; that contains at least one half of one percent alcohol by volume; that is treated by processing, filtration, or another method of manufacture that is not generally recognized as a traditional process in the production of beer as described in 27 CFR 25.55; and to which is added caffeine or other stimulants; or (2) A beverage that contains at least one half of one percent alcohol by volume; that is treated by processing, filtration, or another method of manufacture that is not generally recognized as a traditional process in the production of beer as described in 27 CFR 25.55; to which is added a flavor or other ingredient containing alcohol, except for hop extract; to which is added caffeine or other stimulants; for which the producer is required to file a formula for approval with the United States Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau pursuant to 27 CFR 25.55; and that is not exempt pursuant to 27 CFR 25.55(f).

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
